 Well, cheer up, Greg. There's a spiritual baptism (Titus 3:5) that washes you clean and gave you "rebirth". Remember that the thief on the cross wasn't water baptized (he was saved by faith in Christ) , but Jesus said to the thief, "Today you will be with me in paradise". Water Baptism is like circumcision in a way. In the Old Testament people were justified by faith in God (note Genesis 15:6), the same way we today are justified by faith in Christ (note Ephesians 2:8-9 and also Romans 10:9-10). Circumcision was just an outward ritual of sorts that symbolized the inward circumcision of the heart that God does in a person (many scriptures). So you're probably saved already by faith in Christ. Do recommend you go to church once in a while (if not often) and get water baptized. Something like the Assembly (Assemblies) of God Church is pretty good and Biblically-based. It will do wonders for your mindset. God bless, bro!
